results.definition: not of natural origin; prepared or made artificially
artificial as if portrayed in a film
involving or of the nature of synthesis (combining separate elements to form a coherent whole) as opposed to analysis
examples: limnology is essentially a synthetic science composed of elements...that extend well beyond the limits of biology

results.definition: a compound made artificially by chemical reactions
of a proposition whose truth value is determined by observation or facts
examples: `all men are arrogant' is a synthetic proposition
counterfeit rhetoric that flourishes when passions are synthetic

results.definition: systematic combining of root and modifying elements into single words
